IV (Notices) NOTICES FROM EUROPEAN UNION INSTITUTIONS AND BODIES EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT 2008-2009 SESSION Sittings of 22 to 25 September 2008 BRUSSELS MINUTES (2008/C 309 E/01) PROCEEDINGS OF THE SITTING IN THE CHAIR: Hans-Gert PÖTTERING President 1. Resumption of the session The sitting opened at 17.00. 2. Approval of the Minutes of the previous sitting The Minutes of the previous sitting were approved. 4.12.2008 EN C 309 E/1 Official Journal of the European Union Monday 22 September 2008

3. Composition of Parliament Graham Booth had given notice of his resignation as an MEP with effect from 01.10.2008. In line with Rule 4(1), Parliament established the vacancy as of the abovementioned date and informed the national authorities concerned. The Italian authorities had given notice of the following: — the end of the term of office at the European Parliament of Giuseppe Castiglione on account of incom- patibilities within the meaning of Article 7(3) of the Act of 20 September 1976 concerning the election of the Members of the European Parliament by direct universal suffrage; — the election to the European Parliament, replacing Giuseppe Castiglione, of Maddalena Calia, second on the relevant list of replacements, following the decision by the first person on the list, Michele Cimino, not to take up his mandate as an MEP. Parliament took note, with effect from 12.09.2008. Under Rule 3(2), until such time as her credentials had been verified or a ruling had been given on any dispute, and provided that she had previously made a written declaration stating that she did not hold any office incompatible with that of Member of the European Parliament, Maddalena Calia would take her seat in Parliament and on its bodies and would enjoy all the rights attaching thereto. 4. Verification of credentials On a proposal from the JURI Committee, Parliament validated the mandates of the following Members: Paolo Bartolozzi and Erminio Enzo Boso, with effect from 23.06.2008, Elisabetta Gardini and Giovanni Robusti, with effect from 30.05.2008, and Maria Grazia Pagano, with effect from 17.06.2008. 5. Composition of committees and delegations At the request of the ALDE Group, Parliament ratified the following appointment: — Delegation to the EU-Russia Parliamentary Cooperation Committee: Andrzej Wielowieyski. 6. Proclamation of 23 August as European Day of Remembrance for Victims of Stalinism and Nazism — Combating the trafficking of children (written declarations) Written declaration 0044/2008, submitted by Marianne Mikko, Christopher Beazley, Inese Vaidere, Zita Gurmai and Alexander Alvaro, on the proclamation of 23 August as European Day of Remembrance for Victims of Stalinism and Nazism, had been signed by the majority of Parliament's component Members. Consequently, in accordance with Rule 116(4), it would be forwarded to its addressees and published, together with the names of the signatories, in the Texts Adopted of the sitting of 23.09.2008. C 309 E/2 EN 4.12.2008 Official Journal of the European Union Monday 22 September 2008

Written declaration 0050/2008, submitted by Marusya Ivanova Lyubcheva, Zita Gurmai, Diana Wallis, Eva-Britt Svensson and Anna Záborská, on combating the trafficking of children, had been signed by the majority of Parliament's component Members. Consequently, in accordance with Rule 116(4), it would be forwarded to its addressees and published, together with the names of the signatories, in the Texts Adopted of the sitting of 21.10.2008. 7. Signature of acts adopted under codecision The President announced that, on Wednesday, he and the President of the Council would sign the following acts adopted under the codecision procedure pursuant to Rule 68: — Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EC) No 460/2004 establishing the European Network and Information Security Agency as regards its duration (03643/2008/LEX — C6-0325/2008 — 2007/0291(COD)) — Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on the inland transport of dangerous goods (03656/2008/LEX — C6-0322/2008 — 2006/0278(COD)) — Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on common rules for the operation of air services in the Community (Recast) (03670/2008/LEX — C6-0321/2008 — 2006/0130(COD)) 8. International Tropical Timber Agreement 2006 * — International Tropical Timber Agreement 2006 (debate) Report on the draft Council decision on the conclusion on behalf of the European Community of the International Tropical Timber Agreement, 2006 [11964/2007 — C6-0326/2007 — 2006/0263(CNS)] — Committee on International Trade. Rapporteur: Caroline Lucas (A6-0313/2008) Oral question (O-0074/2008) by Helmuth Markov, on behalf of the INTA Committee, to the Commission: International Tropical Timber Agreement (ITTA) 2006 (B6-0458/2008) Caroline Lucas introduced the report. Helmuth Markov moved the oral question. The following spoke: Jacques Barrot (Vice-President of the Commission). The following spoke: Georgios Papastamkos (deputising for the rapporteur for the opinion of the JURI Committee), Zbigniew Zaleski, on behalf of the PPE-DE Group, David Martin, on behalf of the PSE Group, Magor Imre Csibi, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Wies ł aw Stefan Kuc, on behalf of the UEN Group, Margrete Auken, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Jens Holm, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Maciej Marian Giertych, Non-attached Member, Georgios Papastamkos, Francisco Assis, Jean-Claude Martinez, Corien Wortmann-Kool, Rovana Plumb and Béla Glattfelder. The following spoke under the ‘ catch-the-eye ’ procedure: Zuzana Roithová and Czes ł aw Adam Siekierski. The following spoke: Jacques Barrot and Caroline Lucas, who put a question to the Commission, which Jacques Barrot answered. Motion for a resolution to wind up the debate tabled pursuant to Rule 108(5): — Helmuth Markov, on behalf of the INTA Committee, on the International Tropical Timber Agreement (ITTA) 2006 (B6-0422/2008). The debate closed. Vote: Minutes of 24.09.2008, Item 10.2 and Minutes of 24.09.2008, Item 10.3 . 16. The following spoke under the ‘ catch-the-eye ’ procedure: Zuzana Roithová and Íñigo Méndez de Vigo. The following spoke: Costas Botopoulos. The debate closed. MINUTES (2008/C 309 E/03) PROCEEDINGS OF THE SITTING IN THE CHAIR: Hans-Gert PÖTTERING President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 09.00. 2. Statement by the President The President made a statement on the shooting at a vocational school in Kauhajoki, Finland, on 23.09.2008. He expressed Parliament ‘ s condolences and sympathy to the victims ’ families and friends. 3. MINUTES (2008/C 309 E/04) PROCEEDINGS OF THE SITTING IN THE CHAIR: Marek SIWIEC Vice-President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 10.00. 2. Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (AFSJ) 2007 (motions for resolutions tabled) Oral question (O-0005/2008) by Jean-Marie Cavada, on behalf of the LIBE Committee, to the Council: 2007 annual debate on the progress made in the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (FSJA) (Articles 2 and 39 of the EU Treaty) (B6-0006/2008) Oral question (O-0006/2008) by Jean-Marie Cavada, on behalf of the LIBE Committee, to the Commission: 2007 annual debate on the progress made in the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (FSJA) (Articles 2 and 39 of the EU Treaty) (B6-0007/2008) The debate had been held on 31.01.2008 (Minutes of 31.01.2008, Item 4) . Motion for a resolution to wind up the debate tabled pursuant to Rule 108(5): — Gérard Deprez, on behalf of the LIBE Committee, on the annual debate on the progress made in 2007 in the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (AFSJ) (Articles 2 and 39 of the EU Treaty) (B6-0425/2008). Vote: Minutes of 25.09.2008, Item 7.3 . 3. Transfers of appropriations The Committee on Budgets had considered the Commission's proposal for transfer of appropriations DEC 23/2008 (C6-0302/2008). Having noted the Council's opinion, it had authorised the transfer in full under Article 24(3) of the Financial Regulation of 25.06.2002, as amended on 13.12.2006. 4. Social package (Second part: Cross-border healthcare) (debate) The first part of the debate had been held on 2 September 2008 (Minutes of 02.09.2008, Item 4). Council and Commission statements: Social package (Second part: Cross-border healthcare) Roselyne Bachelot-Narquin (President-in-Office of the Council) and Androula Vassiliou (Member of the Commission) made the statements. The following spoke: John Bowis, on behalf of the PPE-DE Group, Dagmar Roth-Behrendt, on behalf of the PSE Group, Jules Maaten, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Ryszard Czarnecki, on behalf of the UEN Group, Jean Lambert, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Roberto Musacchio, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Derek Roland Clark, on behalf of the IND/DEM Group, Luca Romagnoli, Non-attached Member, Charlotte Cederschiöld, Bernadette Vergnaud, Elizabeth Lynne, Ewa Tomaszewska, Eva-Britt Svensson, Hanne Dahl, Irena Belohorská, Ria Oomen-Ruijten, Anne Van Lancker and Marian Harkin. 4.12.2008 EN C 309 E/273 Official Journal of the European Union Thursday 25 September 2008

Welcome On behalf of Parliament, the President welcomed members of a delegation from the Knesset, led by Amira Dotan, who had taken their seats in the distinguished visitors' gallery. * * * The following spoke: Sarah Ludford, who, in reference to an e-mail sent by the Secretary-General on Tuesday 23.09.2008 concerning the resumption of Parliament's activities in Strasbourg as of the October II part- session, asked on what basis this decision had been taken (the President replied that an announcement would be made to all Members), and Alexander Alvaro, who complained that the poster calling for support for Written Declaration 0075/2008 on holding all European Parliament plenary sessions in Brussels had been removed without the consent of the declaration's authors (the President took note). 6. Communication of Council common positions The President announced, pursuant to Rule 57(1), that the following common positions had been received from the Council, together with the reasons which had led to their adoption, and the Commission's position on: — Common position adopted by the Council 19 May 2008 with a view to the adoption of a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for Community action to achieve the sustainable use of pesticides (06124/5/2008 — C6-0323/2008 — 2006/0132(COD)) referred to responsible: ENVI — Common position adopted by the Council on 15 September 2008 with a view to the adoption of a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market and repealing Council Directives 79/117/EEC and 91/414/EEC (11119/8/2008 — C6-0326/2008 — 2006/0136(COD)) referred to responsible: ENVI The three-month period available to Parliament to adopt its position would therefore begin the following day (26.09.2008).
